title: Clive Goodyear
text:
Clive Goodyear (born 15 January 1961) is an English former <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>. He made 232 appearances in the <a href="English%20Football%20League">English Football League</a> for <a href="Luton%20Town%20F.C.">Luton Town</a>, <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a>, <a href="Wimbledon%20F.C.">Wimbledon</a> and <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>. Goodyear also played in the <a href="1988%20FA%20Cup%20Final">1988 FA Cup Final</a>.
Life and career.
He started his career at <a href="Luton%20Town%20F.C.">Luton Town</a>, after five years with the Hatters moved to <a href="Plymouth%20Argyle%20F.C.">Plymouth Argyle</a>, and after three seasons with Plymouth he moved to <a href="Wimbledon%20F.C.">Wimbledon</a>. In the <a href="1988%20FA%20Cup%20Final">1988 FA Cup Final</a>, in which Wimbledon famously upset <a href="Liverpool%20F.C.">Liverpool</a> 1–0, Goodyear was adjudged to have fouled <a href="John%20Aldridge">John Aldridge</a>, which gave Liverpool a controversial penalty. Aldridge took it, but Wimbledon goalkeeper <a href="Dave%20Beasant">Dave Beasant</a> saved it.
Although being named in the squad for that Cup Final, he was not a regular in the side and only made 26 appearances in three years and was sold to <a href="Brentford%20F.C.">Brentford</a>, where he spent <a href="1990%E2%80%9391%20in%20English%20football">one season</a>.
He finished his career in <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a> with <a href="Sea%20Bee">Ernest Borel</a>. After sustaining a major knee injury he began studying physiotherapy and returned to <a href="Luton%20Town%20F.C.">Luton Town</a> as a physiotherapist in 1993. He was then a physio at <a href="Cardiff%20City%20F.C.">Cardiff City</a> and <a href="Chester%20City%20F.C.">Chester City</a>.
